main event: On March 22, 1957, in Center Sandwich, New Hampshire, an unidentified flying object was observed by approximately 50 people. The object was described as a cigar-shaped or torpedo-shaped, whitish in color, with an iridescent sheen, estimated to be the size of a bomber aircraft, at an altitude of 15,000 to 20,000 feet, and traveling at a speed of 700 to 800 miles per hour. It was observed in the southwest sky for about 20 minutes before disappearing.
interesting points: Multiple witnesses, approximately 50 people, observed the UFO, adding credibility to the sighting.
The description of the UFO as a cigar-shaped or torpedo-shaped object with an iridescent sheen and estimated to be the size of a bomber aircraft is unusual and detailed.
The observed speed of the UFO at 700 to 800 miles per hour is significantly faster than known aircraft at that time.
The absence of sound, tail, trail, or exhaust from the object adds to its mysterious nature.
The object hovered for approximately 15 minutes before rising vertically at a high rate of speed and disappearing, indicating advanced capabilities.
sighted object: cigar-shaped or torpedo-shaped UFO with an iridescent sheen
